author: mininny
content: It was done on a devnet set up with ansible (like the peerdas-devnets) and I haven't used kurtosis to run it. I can DM you the link to grafana/dora/and ssh access to the problematic nodes. Would that work as well?

author: mininny
content: Do you mean with the getBlobV2 image from geth? Then no we haven't yet, but we definitely can

author: jimmygchen
content:
I had local interop working with geth. The geth impl is interopable but haven't offload the computation, so it might actually be more CPU intensive than the existing CL-only PeerDAS implementation

The images used are here:
https://notes.ethereum.org/@ethpandaops/peerdas-devnet-6#

author: parithosh
content: ooo this is amazing finding! wdym by hasn't offloaded computation? are we just computing things on the EL and CL right now?

author: jimmygchen
content: Computation happens in geth right now whenever we call getPayload and get blobs as a quick way to have something interop-able, so we still need the complete implementation to have the gains

author: jimmygchen
content: Note that because it happens on demand, it takes longer for geth to respond, so shorter slot time may not work

author: parithosh
content: ahh got it! so it depends on geth to finish the implementation?

author: parithosh
content: and what about nethermind or reth? (cc <@277500722655002624> <@519796549279023105> )

author: __flcl
content: We need a couple of days

author: jimmygchen
content: Yep but itâ€™s ready for CL to use for testing

author: parithosh
content:
Yep, makes sense! <@360491619402776577> would the rest of the impl be done by you or lightclient? 

and has any other CL looked into interop-ing?

author: jimmygchen
content: Also there are a few comments on the spec PR that hasnâ€™t been finalized, so it might require some changes on our side

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Depends on when you need it. Within the next week, then probably matt, otherwise I can do it

author: parithosh
content: I think we have some leeway considering CLs are also working on implementations. But if there's indeed un-expected surprises it would be better to know earlier rather than later. Perhaps we wait to see what nethermind and reth say with their implementation status?

author: manunlp
content:
So the issue was, for some reason, some Prysm nodes were stopped and restarted during the first epoch after genesis.
There is a known issue where Prysm cannot sync when it was stopped during the first epoch after genesis.
==> The workaround is to wipe the DB and resync, which worked.

author: manunlp
content: (First epoch was deneb for information)

author: corcoranwill
content:
Hi All - 

I started at the EF as a Research Coordinator a month ago and have been asked to help provide some PM support on PeerDAS.  ATM, I am just lurking in the PeerDAS channels trying to get context - but hope to start being a bit more extroverted soon :).

I've been sending most of you friend requests - if I missed you, my apoligies - please feel free to connect.

I hope to pull together and maintain high-signal PM resources that add value and reduce friction for you all.  That said, I will need some feedback.  If you have thoughts on information you would like to see tracked, etc - please feel free to DM me or, better yet - snag some time on my calendar [here](https://calendar.app.google/yKn9qiRDv6BMZbNS7).  

RN, I am just trying to get up to speed a quick convo can go a long ways.  

Thanks!
